title: iPSC Cell Culture – Maintenance and Expansion

authors.name: Jacob Marsh
authors.affiliation: Washington University in Saint Louis - WUSTL (MO)

source.body: 1 vial of iPSC should be thawed into 1 well of a 6 well plate.

source.description:
Add
DMEM/F12 to a 15 ml conical tube labeled with the iPSC line name and passage number.
Remove cells from liquid nitrogen storage.

Quickly thaw cells in
water bath and/or in hands.
Just prior to complete thaw, remove vial from water bath.

Transfer the contents of the cryo-vial (~
) into the 15 ml conical tube.

Spin at
for
at
.
Aspirate media.

Resuspend cells in
mTesR1 (supplemented with
—
Rock Inhibitor) by pipetting two times.
Transfer the cell solution to one well of a 6-well plate.

Incubate at
in 6 % CO2.
Replace the media daily until cells are ready to split or analyze.
Aspirate media.

source.body: Media should be changed daily. It is okay to skip a media change one time each week if double feeding is performed; however, this is largely dependent on the density of the cells and volume of media (do not double feed if cells are more than 70% confluent).

source.description:
Gently add fresh mTesR1 to cells (volume depends on cell density and well size).
per well to 24 well plate
—
per well to 6 well plate
—
to 10 cm2 plate

Incubate at
in 6 % CO2.
Under microscope, remove differentiated cells with p20 or p200 tip (depending on the amount of differentiation). Transfer the cells/media to a biohazard bag.

source.body:
When differentiating cells appear in the culture, it is important to remove all the cells promptly.
Repeated cleaning may be necessary over the course of several days to remove all the material. If differentiation is excessive and line is precious, perform subcloning.

source.description: Gently wash cells with 1x PBS.

Add fresh mTesR1.
per well to 24 well plate
—
per well to 6 well plate
—
to 10 cm2 plate

Incubate at
in 6 % CO2 until cells are 60 — 80 % confluent. Change mTesR1 media daily until
cells are needed. Repeat cleaning as necessary.

iPSCs grow on Matrigel. Plates should be coated with Matrigel at least 1 hour prior to plating and no
longer than 24 hours prior to plating cells:
in 12 well plate
in 6 well plate
in 10 cm2 plate

source.body:
It is critical to keep Matrigel on ice while coating. Prior to plating cells, ensure Matrigel has not
evaporated from well.

source.body: To avoid aspirating cell pellet, it is OK to leave a small amount of media ( — ).

source.description:
Resuspend cell pellet with mTesR1 (Rock Inhibitor addition varies, see below).
mTesR1 per well of a 6 well plate
  • Our goal is to maintain iPSC lines without using Rock Inhibitor; however, this must be done through careful weaning off Rock Inhibitor
  • All cells should be thawed in Rock Inhibitor:
-
concentration for new iPSC lines, lines thawed from 96 well after editing.
-
concentration if thawing from a line without knowledge of its Rock sensitivity.
-
concentration for all other lines (for lines still exposed to Rock Inhibitor, use
. Otherwise, do not use Rock Inhibitor.)
Pipet cells 2 times only to preserve clumps.

Transfer cell suspension to appropriate plate (pre-coated with Matrigel for at least
).
  • For maintenance, dilute cells 1:3 in mTesR1
  • For expansion, plate all cells

in 6 % CO2 until cells are 60 — 80% confluent. Change mTesR1 media daily until cells are needed.

source.description:
Resuspend cell pellet with mTesR1 (No Rock Inhibitor).
  • Use volume appropriate for freezing
  • Assume
  • per cryovial total and add ½ total volume of mTesR1
  • Pipet cells 1 — 2 times only to preserve cell clumps
Assume
per cryovial total and add ½ total volume of mTesR1

source.body: Example: to freeze 10 tubes, you will need total and will add mTesR1 to cell pellet (and of 2x Freezing Media below)

source.description: Add an equal volume of cold 2x Freezing Media (20 % DMSO, FBS). Pipet cells 1 time only to preserve cell clumps.

Transfer cell suspension to pre-labeled cryovials (
per cryovial).
Ensure that cryovials are labeled with the following:
  • Cell Type
  • Line Name
  • Passage #
  • Date
  • Your Name

Freeze vials at
in foam racks for
—
.
Transfer vials to liquid nitrogen for long-term storage.

description: This protocol is about Maintenance and Expansion of induced pluripotent stem cells.
